diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: TORCH infections, congenital candidiasis, herpes virus infection, hereditary and autoimmune bullous diseases
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Diagnosis made based on treponemal serologic test; presence of respiratory distress, low birth weight, hepatosplenomegaly, and characteristic bullous targetoid lesions. Negative Warthin-Starry stain for spirochetes, but detection of Treponema pallidum genomic DNA by nested PCR confirmed congenital syphilis.
